org.glassfish.tyrus.core

Class TyrusEndpointWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.glassfish.tyrus.core.TyrusEndpointWrapper

  • public class TyrusEndpointWrapper
extends Object
    Wraps the registered application class. There is one TyrusEndpointWrapper for each application class, which handles all the methods.
    Author:
    Danny Coward (danny.coward at oracle.com), Stepan Kopriva (stepan.kopriva at oracle.com), Martin Matula (martin.matula at oracle.com), Pavel Bucek (pavel.bucek at oracle.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static interface  TyrusEndpointWrapper.OnCloseListener
      Close listener.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TyrusEndpointWrapper

        public TyrusEndpointWrapper(Class<? extends Endpoint> endpointClass,
                    EndpointConfig configuration,
                    ComponentProviderService componentProvider,
                    WebSocketContainer container,
                    String contextPath,
                    ServerEndpointConfig.Configurator configurator,
                    TyrusEndpointWrapper.OnCloseListener onCloseListener,
                    ClusterContext clusterContext,
                    EndpointEventListener endpointEventListener)
                     throws DeploymentException
        Create TyrusEndpointWrapper for class that extends Endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endpointClass - endpoint class for which the wrapper is created.
        configuration - endpoint configuration.
        componentProvider - component provider.
        container - container where the wrapper is running.
        clusterContext - cluster context instance. null indicates standalone mode.
        endpointEventListener - endpoint event listener.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException

      • TyrusEndpointWrapper

        public TyrusEndpointWrapper(Endpoint endpoint,
                    EndpointConfig configuration,
                    ComponentProviderService componentProvider,
                    WebSocketContainer container,
                    String contextPath,
                    ServerEndpointConfig.Configurator configurator,
                    TyrusEndpointWrapper.OnCloseListener onCloseListener,
                    ClusterContext clusterContext,
                    EndpointEventListener endpointEventListener)
                     throws DeploymentException
        Create TyrusEndpointWrapper for Endpoint instance or AnnotatedEndpoint instance.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - endpoint instance for which the wrapper is created.
        configuration - endpoint configuration.
        componentProvider - component provider.
        container - container where the wrapper is running.
        clusterContext - cluster context instance. null indicates standalone mode.
        endpointEventListener - endpoint event listener.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException

      • getEndpointPath

        public String getEndpointPath()
        Server-side; Get Endpoint absolute path.
        Returns:
        endpoint absolute path.

      • getServerEndpointPath

        public String getServerEndpointPath()
        Server-side; Get server endpoint path.

        In this context, server endpoint path is exactly what is present in ServerEndpoint annotation or returned from ServerEndpointConfig.getPath() method call. Context path is not included.

        Returns:
        server endpoint path.
        See Also:
        ServerEndpoint.value(), ServerEndpointConfig.getPath()

      • getNegotiatedExtensions

        public List<Extension> getNegotiatedExtensions(List<Extension> clientExtensions)
        Server-side; Get the negotiated extensions' names based on the extensions supported by client.
        Parameters:
        clientExtensions - names of the extensions' supported by client.
        Returns:
        names of extensions supported by both client and class that implements this one.

      • getNegotiatedProtocol

        public String getNegotiatedProtocol(List<String> clientProtocols)
        Server-side; Compute the sub-protocol which will be used.
        Parameters:
        clientProtocols - sub-protocols supported by client.
        Returns:
        negotiated sub-protocol, null if none found.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

                                     List<Extension> extensions)

        Parameters:

        subprotocol - used.
        extensions - extensions used.
        Returns:
        Session representing the connection.

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(TyrusWebSocket socket,
             ByteBuffer messageBytes)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection has an incoming text message from the given remote endpoint.
        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who sent the message.
        messageBytes - the message.

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(TyrusWebSocket socket,
             String messageString)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection has an incoming text message from the given remote endpoint.
        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who sent the message.
        messageString - the message.

      • onPartialMessage

        public void onPartialMessage(TyrusWebSocket socket,
                    String partialString,
                    boolean last)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection has an incoming partial text message from the given remote endpoint. Partial text messages are passed in sequential order, one piece at a time. If an implementation does not support streaming, it will need to reconstruct the message here and pass the whole thing along.
        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who sent the message.
        partialString - the String message.
        last - to indicate if this is the last partial string in the sequence

      • onPartialMessage

        public void onPartialMessage(TyrusWebSocket socket,
                    ByteBuffer partialBytes,
                    boolean last)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection has an incoming partial binary message from the given remote endpoint. Partial binary messages are passed in sequential order, one piece at a time. If an implementation does not support streaming, it will need to reconstruct the message here and pass the whole thing along.
        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who sent the message.
        partialBytes - the piece of the binary message.
        last - to indicate if this is the last partial byte buffer in the sequence

      • onPong

        public void onPong(TyrusWebSocket socket,
          ByteBuffer bytes)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection has an incoming pong message from the given remote endpoint.
        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who sent the message.
        bytes - the message.

      • onPing

        public void onPing(TyrusWebSocket socket,
          ByteBuffer bytes)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection has an incoming ping message from the given remote endpoint.

        The endpoint needs to respond as soon as possible (see the websocket RFC). No involvement from application layer, there is no ping listener.

        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who sent the message.
        bytes - the message.

      • onClose

        public void onClose(TyrusWebSocket socket,
           CloseReason closeReason)
        Called by the provider when the web socket connection to the given remote endpoint has just closed.
        Parameters:
        socket - TyrusWebSocket who has just closed the connection.

        configuration.

      • broadcast

        public Map<Session,Future<?>> broadcast(String message)
        Broadcasts text message to all connected clients.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be broadcasted.
        Returns:
        map of sessions and futures for user to get the information about status of the message. Messages send from other cluster nodes are not included.

      • broadcast

        public Map<Session,Future<?>> broadcast(ByteBuffer message)
        Broadcasts binary message to all connected clients.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be broadcasted.
        Returns:
        map of sessions and futures for user to get the information about status of the message. Messages send from other cluster nodes are not included.

      • upgrade

        public final boolean upgrade(UpgradeRequest request)
        Server side check for protocol specific information to determine whether the request can be upgraded.

        The default implementation will check for the presence of the Upgrade header with a value of WebSocket.

        Parameters:
        request - TODO
        Returns:
        true if the request should be upgraded to a WebSocket connection

      • createSocket

        public TyrusWebSocket createSocket(ProtocolHandler handler)
        Factory method to create new TyrusWebSocket instances. Developers may wish to override this to return customized TyrusWebSocket implementations.
        Parameters:
        handler - the ProtocolHandler to use with the newly created TyrusWebSocket.
        Returns:
        TODO

      • onError

        public boolean onError(TyrusWebSocket socket,
              Throwable t)
        This method will be invoked if an unexpected exception is caught by the WebSocket runtime.
        Parameters:
        socket - the websocket being processed at the time the exception occurred.
        t - the unexpected exception.
        Returns:
        true if the WebSocket should be closed otherwise false.

      • onHandShakeResponse

        public void onHandShakeResponse(UpgradeRequest request,
                       UpgradeResponse response)
        Invoked when server side handshake is ready to send response.

        Changes in response parameter will be reflected in data sent back to client.

        Parameters:
        request - original request which caused this handshake.
        response - response to be send.
